author: MSNBC.com
title: Members of Congress lay out legislation to Help Americans during economic crisis
description: Reps. Pramila Jayapal (D-WA) and Jason Crow (D-CO) speak with Kasie Hunt about their separate efforts to help those who are struggling economically during this crisis: the 'Paycheck Guarantee Act' and the 'Health Force and Resilience Force Act.'

title: Georgia AG calls for DOJ probe into handling of Arbery case

author: MSNBC.com
title: Schiff: Pence’s embrace of Flynn 'not surprising, but pathetic'
description: Adam Smith (D-CA), chairman of the House Intelligence Committee, reacts after Vice President Mike Pence said he'd 'be happy' to see Mike Flynn back in the Trump administration.

author: MSNBC.com
title: After volunteering in NYC, Colorado doctor returns home in time for Mother’s Day
description: After a month-long stint volunteering in a New York City field hospital, Dr. Comilla Sasson returned home to Colorado where her two young children were waiting.
source.name: MSNBC

title: Times of Crisis Then & Now
description: The Coronavirus pandemic may feel like an epic battle, but the U.S. has won epic battles before. MSNBC anchor Joshua Johnson shares how we create a better post-pandemic U.S.

author: MSNBC.com
title: Ohio's governor discusses safety as businesses set to reopen
description: Ohio is set to ease restrictions this week, allowing for retail outlets to reopen and for outdoor restaurant seating. Gov. Mike DeWine joins Morning Joe to discuss balancing public safety with restarting the economy.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Trump concerned about re-election chances: report
description: Amid the coronavirus pandemic, the president is concerned about his re-election chances as polling shows him trailing Joe Biden. The panel discusses.

title: Obama calls Trump's virus response a 'chaotic disaster'
description: Former President Obama over the weekend called the Trump administration’s response to the coronavirus pandemic 'an absolute chaotic disaster'.

title: Actor Jerry Stiller dies at the age of 92
description: Actor Jerry Stiller died from natural causes on Monday at the age of 92, his son Ben Stiller announced on Twitter.

title: Republicans grow nervous over losing Senate in the fall
description: Republicans are increasingly nervous they could lose control of the Senate this fall because of the president's handling of the coronavirus as well as the economy, according to new reporting.

author: MSNBC.com
title: Concerns in West Wing as two WH staffers test positive
description: As the president tries to convince the nation it's safe to return to work, one of his own top advisers is saying it's currently scary to work in the White House after two people with West Wing access tested positive. The Morning Joe panel discusses.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Pence says he'd be happy to see Flynn back in government
description: Vice President Mike Pence says in a new interview that he welcomes the idea of bringing Michael Flynn back into government, yet in 2017 Pence said he knew Flynn lied to him. The panel discusses.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Can Biden beat Trump from the comfort of his basement?
description: Democratic communications strategist Lis Smith discusses her view on how Joe Biden can beat Trump from his basement. Adrienne Elrod and Tom Rogers also joins the discussion.

author: Msnbc
title: Following Flynn case, Obama says 'rule of law is at risk'
description: Obama's assessment that the "rule of law is at risk" is correct but incomplete. The rule of law has also already been damaged by a direct assault.
content:
It did not escape former President Obama's attention that Attorney General Bill Barr's Justice Department dropped charges against one of Donald Trump's allies -- who'd already pleaded twice in open court to being guilty.
Obama, using the kind of language he … [+4259 chars]
source.name: MSNBC

author: Msnbc
title: Trump takes issue with 'the whole concept' of virus testing
description: One of the key problems facing the nation is that the president doesn't seem to be improving -- even in areas he really ought to understand by now.
content:
A couple of months ago, Donald Trump visited the CDC offices in Atlanta, and when asked about escalating coronavirus crisis, he assured everyone, "I like this stuff."
The president added, in apparent reference to epidemiology, "I really get it. People are su… [+3042 chars]
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: MLB players, league begin 'battle' to commence season

author: MSNBC.com
title: Amazon deforestation at all-time high amid COVID-19 crisis

title: Sen. Smith: White House spreading 'chaos' instead of 'clarity'
description: Senator Tina Smith (D-MN) tells Ayman Mohyeldin what she plans to ask Dr. Anthony Fauci when Congress holds remote hearings on the COVID-19 crisis. Smith says that due to a "lack of national leadership from the White House" there are many outstanding

title: Trump creating his own deep state, says writer

title: 'Her songs were a soundtrack for an entire generation of Black women': Sharpton on the death of soul singer Betty Wright

title: Garrett: In best case scenario, deadly coronavirus outbreaks will continue for next three years

title: What you should know about the rare new sickness affecting children

title: Rep. Shalala: 'We just don't have the testing to open up'

author: MSNBC.com
title: Sen. Chris Murphy: Trump White House ‘gave up’ on pandemic response
description: Senator Chris Murphy called the White House’s response to the pandemic abysmal: “The president just gave up … they have effectively left the response to the states and hospital systems and municipalities.”

author: MSNBC.com
title: Wallace: Trump doesn't value the health of his staff. Why should we expect him to care about ours?
description: Three members of the White House coronavirus task force will self-quarantine after possible exposure to COVID-19. Nicolle Wallace says, “For Donald Trump not to value their health, it explains a little bit, doesn’t it, why he wouldn’t value ours.”

author: MPX
title: White House takes new precautions to stop virus from spreading...

title: Tom Colicchio on how the restaurant industry is bearing the brunt of job losses

title: Trump calls killing of Ahmaud Arbery 'horrible' and 'heartbreaking'
